001import javax.swing.JComponent;
002import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
003
004import java.awt.Image;
005
006//import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
007//import java.awt.image.AffineTransformOp;
008
009import java.lang.Math;
010/** GamePiece.java - An abstract class used to build all game pieces in game
011* This class is abstract, serving as a blueprint to ensure player, bullet, and all asteroid objects
012* can be handled correctly by the game controller
013* This class satisfies requirement f. of project specification
014* @author Daniel Andrews
015* @version Final Project
016*/
017public abstract class GamePiece extends JComponent {
018        private BufferedImage image, // Each gamepiece will use a BufferedImage to paint itself on the game canvas
019                                  rotatedImage;
020        private Image animationImage;
021
022        /** Sets the image to be rendered by the game piece
023         * @param bf Image to be set
024        */
025        public  void setImage(BufferedImage bf) {
026                image = bf;
027        };
028
029        /** Sets the rotated image to be rendered in specific rotation
030         * @param bf Image to be set
031        */
032        public void setRotatedImage(BufferedImage bf) {
033                rotatedImage = bf;
034        }
035
036        public void setAnimationImage(Image animationImage) {
037                this.animationImage = animationImage;
038        }
039
040        /** Returns original image of sprite
041        * @return Original image of sprite
042        */
043        public BufferedImage getImage() {
044                return image;
045        }
046
047        /** Returns rotated image of sprite
048        * @return Rotated image of sprite
049        */
050        public BufferedImage getRotatedImage() {
051                return rotatedImage;
052        }
053
054        public Image getAnimationImage() {
055                return animationImage;
056        }
057
058        /** Returns true if this object is colliding with another GamePiece
059        * @param another Object to check for collision
060        * @return true if this object is colliding with other GamePiece
061        */
062        public boolean isCollidingWith(GamePiece another) {
063                double range = this.getMaskRadius() + another.getMaskRadius(); // Range of collision masks of both objects
064                double[] myCenter = this.getCenter(); // Get centers of both objects
065                double[] otherCenter = another.getCenter();
066                // Since the collision masks are circular, a simple calculation of distance between centerpoints can check collision
067                double distance = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(myCenter[0] - otherCenter[0], 2) + Math.pow(myCenter[1] - otherCenter[1], 2));
068                if (distance < range) {
069                        return true; // true if objects are colliding
070                }
071
072                return false; // false if objects are not colliding
073        }
074
075        /** Returns the distance to another GamePiece
076        * @param another Object to check distance from
077        * @return Distance between objects
078        */
079        public double distanceTo(GamePiece another) {
080                double[] myCenter = this.getCenter(); // Get centers of both objects
081                double[] otherCenter = another.getCenter();
082                return Math.sqrt(Math.pow(myCenter[0] - otherCenter[0], 2) + Math.pow(myCenter[1] - otherCenter[1], 2)); // Return distance between objects
083        }
084
085        // These methods will differ between classes but should be defined in each game class
086        public abstract void tick(); // Called every frame update
087        public abstract void move(); // Moves object, all game objects move in asteroids
088        public abstract void destroy(); // When object is destroyed
089        public abstract double getMaskRadius(); // Masks are fine-tuned based on sprite
090        public abstract double[] getCenter(); // Each object should be able to return it's center
091}
